intro: Butayea, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble bells, which bloom in clusters. Butayea typically grows in high-altitude regions and prefers well-drained, rocky soils. It is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been cultivated for its unique floral display.
